posts.post_content:
Lame... Okay, we get it. Land destruction is not allowed. That idiotic card in Innistrad (Scorch the Fields) was bad enough - because fire only damage humans, apparently.  
  
Then, we moved on to Craterize, which was Stone Rain +1 mana for no reason at all... as if Stone Rain was tearing up Standard, or as if anyone has played a targeted land destruction deck in Standard in the past 10+ years.  
  
So, now we get this, because adding a worthless Goblin means the land should coast 5 to destroy?! Ugh... just stop! Either stop printing drek land destruction or at least make the cards playable in Limited!
posts.html:

posts.post_content: Alright, everybody is forgetting that this was printed in the same set as [Goblin Electromancer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Electromancer), and that if you land one of those turn two it curves quite nicely into [Guttersnipe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Guttersnipe) and then this. I know that there are better 5 cost cards in the set, even for goblin tribal a la [Goblin Rally](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Rally), but I find that this card provides decent tempo for building a goblin army while the opponent is a turn behind on their resources.

Posted By: Goatllama (11/14/2012 10:42:50 AM)

posts.post_content:
It's funny to see people complaining about LD. LD being strong SUCKS in small formats like standard and block. It's not fun to play with or against because of how non-interactive it is.  
  
In draft, this card isn't the worst, although [Destroy the Evidence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Destroy the Evidence) is definitely stronger suited than this card for the job. Popping a land can keep your opponent off of a shaky manabase or take away their splash color. Getting a 1/1 dude isn't the worst either, there's a decent amount of pump in the format, [Chorus of Might](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chorus of Might) is a thing and so is [Collective Blessing](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Collective Blessing). There's definitely going to be a deck where this is a reasonable 23rd card once Gatecrash and "sinker" are released and we're looking at drafting 4 and 5 color decks.
posts.html:
It's funny to see people complaining about LD. LD being strong SUCKS in small formats like standard and block. It's not fun to play with or against because of how non-interactive it is.

In draft, this card isn't the worst, although Destroy the Evidence is definitely stronger suited than this card for the job. Popping a land can keep your opponent off of a shaky manabase or take away their splash color. Getting a 1/1 dude isn't the worst either, there's a decent amount of pump in the format, Chorus of Might is a thing and so is Collective Blessing. There's definitely going to be a deck where this is a reasonable 23rd card once Gatecrash and "sinker" are released and we're looking at drafting 4 and 5 color decks.
